greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 1 if n = prime(k)*prime(2+k) for some k, otherwise 0.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..66013
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
mathematica: Array[Boole@ And[Length@ # == 2, Max@ #[[All, -1]] == 1, Subtract @@ PrimePi[#[[All, 1]]] == -2 ] &@ FactorInteger@ # &, 120] (* or *)
With[{s = Array[Prime[#] Prime[# + 2] &, 5]}, ReplacePart[ConstantArray[0, Max@ s], Map[# -> 1 &, s] ] ] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 27 2018 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 24 2018
